slides.title: Hello, and welcome to Burning Stories!
slides.subtitle: Welcome to the Burning Stories research unit - an experiment in understanding creative and participatory leadership
slides.body: The aim of Burning Stories is to study the global Burning Man community. We seek to explain the processes through which community membership evolves across time and space, and how this, in turn, affects their experience of the collective identity. There is a very limited understanding of how its immersive experiences transform individuals, let alone society. That is precisely what we aim to find out with this project.

slides.title: Ready?
slides.body: What was it that brought you here? What do you really care about right now? You are somehow connected to the global 'burner' culture, either as a researcher of it, a leader in it or a co-creator of it. What are the experiences that keep pulling you back into it?
Think back on the last 12 months. Did you go to any 'burns'? What turned out to be central themes for you this time?
What are you curious to learn from studying Burning Man and other burn events and their cultures?
Imagine Burning Man in ten years. What does it look like?

slides.title: Informed consent
slides.instructions:
By completing this form, you are doing two things.

1) You are consenting to participate in a study around participatory cultures such as Burning Man.
2) You are registering an account at the Burning Stories forum, which you will confirm through a link sent to your email.

The purpose of the study is to learn more on emerging topics around participatory cultures such as Burning Man and explore novel ways in engagement between scholars and practitioners.

You give your consent to participate in the study by submitting this form, which will also register an account for you on the forum.

By giving consent you allow the research team to include your data in the study. This means that the researchers will use your comments and other information you publish on the forum as research material in their studies.

The risks of participation are minimal. To protect the confidentiality of the data, the researchers will anonymize all data before using it in research and will only publish quotes or other information in formats from which the author canâ€™t be recognized.

The researchers make every effort to keep the information collected from you private. Results of the research may be presented at meetings or in publications, but your name or other identifying information will not be used.

By participating in the study, you will help enhance scientific understanding of Burning Man and the overall phenomenon of participatory cultures REF

Your participation in this study is completely voluntary . You are free not to participate or to withdraw at any time, for whatever reason.

For more information or questions about this research you may contact platform managers or alternatively e-mail to contact (at) burning-stories.org.
slides.body: These questions will be used to register an account for you on our forum. where you can go back and update your answers.
